title: Work Experience
text:
Department of Biostatistics - Dr. Brian Caffo, JHU – Research Assistant (July 2023 - present)

Evaluated and diagnosed R and Python-based (Keras, PyTorch, TensorFlow) stochastic time-series models – including RNNs, transformers, gaussian process models, and AR models – for regional fMRI data from the Human Connectome Project.

Wearable and Implantable Technology Group - Dr. Ciprian Crainiceanu, JHU – Research Assistant (Sept. 2022 - present)

Biophysics and Computational Biology Lab - Dr. Jackie Vogel, McGill – Research Assistant (Jan 2020 - Aug. 2022)

title: Angela Zhao, BS
text:
Angela Zhao is a final year ScM student in Biostatistics at Johns Hopkins University. She has a Joint BS in Computer Science and Biology with a Minor in Maths from McGill University (2022).
Her research interests are mainly in methods of analyzing time-series data, including stochastic modeling, neural networks, and functional data analysis. Domain-specific application interests include wearable device, imaging, and financial data.
Hobbies include bouldering, investing, stand-up comedy, and playing classical music (fun fact: she previously taught piano for 4 years).

text:

Zhao A, Cui E, Leroux A, Zhou X, Muschelli J, Lindquist M, Crainiceanu C. Objective physical activity is the strongest modifiable predictor of incident Alzheimer’s disease in the UK Biobank (submitted).
Cui E*, Zhao A*, Crainiceanu C, Leroux A. Functional and Distributional Cox Models for UK Biobank Physical Activity Analysis (in preparation).
Zhao A, Lindquist M, Caffo B. Comparing stochastic model performance with applications to fMRI data (in preparation).
